fields.name: Python: Basic Syntax and Variables
fields.description: An introduction to variables, data types, and syntax in Python.
fields.text: This course covers fundamental concepts for new Python developers, including variables, types, syntax, and naming rules.

fields.name: Variables and Basic Syntax
fields.description: Understand what a variable is and how to use it.
fields.text: A variable stores a value. Example: x = 5

fields.name: What is a variable?
fields.description: Write one line of Python code that defines a variable.

fields.name: Introduction to Variables
fields.description: Different ways to use variables in Python.
fields.text: You can also store text in variables. Example: name = 'Alice'

fields.name: Variable with text
fields.description: Write code that stores a string in a variable.

fields.name: Data Types
fields.description: Learn about int, float, str, and bool.
fields.text: Examples: number = 7, price = 19.99, active = True, name = 'Test'

fields.name: Can a variable start with a number?
fields.description: Answer whether the following statement is true:
fields.text: A variable can start with a number.

fields.name: Variable Naming and Rules
fields.description: Learn the rules for valid variable names.
fields.text: Variable names must start with a letter or _, and cannot be a keyword.

fields.name: Choose a valid variable name
fields.description: Select the correct option for a valid Python variable name.
fields.text: Which of the following is a valid variable name?

fields.name: Basic Python Syntax
fields.text:
Valid example: a = 1 + 2
Invalid example: 1 = x

fields.name: Write valid Python syntax
fields.description: Write one line of valid Python syntax to add two numbers.

fields.name: Order the development steps
fields.description: Place the phases of software development in the correct order.
fields.text: Write them in the correct order, separated by commas.

fields.name: Define a float variable
fields.description: Write a Python line that assigns a float value to a variable.
